refers: BE (i.e., copular identification only) / EQUIVALENCE / IDENTIFICATION

stems.BSC: (to be ontologically the) self-same entity (as) (i.e., [to be] simply another name for the self-same entity)
stems.CTE: (to be ontologically the) self-same entity (as) in terms of essence, sense of identity, behavior, personality, mind, etc.
stems.CSV: (to be ontologically) the self-same entity (as) in terms of appearance, physical manifestation or construction
stems.OBJ: what X ontologically is (as opposed to being something else), X’s natural identity, X’s existence as X; to be X as itself (as opposed to something else)

stems.BSC: to be epistemologically equivalent to or (functionally) identified/identifiable as; be (functionally) the same as; be equal to
stems.CTE: to be epistemologically equivalent to or (functionally) identif(ied/-iable) as in terms of essence, sense of identity, behavior, personality, mind, etc.
stems.CSV: to be epistemologically equivalent to or (functionally) identif(ied/-iable) as in terms of appearance, physical manifestation or construction
stems.OBJ: what X is epistemologically equivalent to (as opposed to something else), X’s natural identity, X’s existence as X; to be X as itself (as opposed to something else)

stems.CTE: to be epistemologically synonymous/tantamount/convertible in terms of essence, sense of identity, behavior, personality, mind, etc.
stems.CSV: to be epistemologically synonymous/tantamount/convertible to in terms of appearance or outward physical manifestation
stems.OBJ: (to be )what X is epistemologically synonymous, tantamount, or convertible to (as opposed to something else), X’s convertibility to
